ygData.subject: Introduction to Beserk 2...
ygData.msgSnippet: Stand you re ground, Techy. Don t let him know you re afraid of him. Sky Knight said to the female Predacon of the scientist team. She stood a meter away

Subject: Introduction to Beserk 2...
Message-ID: <8of607+2d8l@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 3015
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: wilddance_mare@...

"Stand you're ground, Techy. Don't let him know you're afraid of 
him." Sky Knight said to the female Predacon of the scientist team. 
She stood a meter away from the huge clone, Beserk. He had even 
dwarfed the largest member of their team. He had a gray face, exactly 
identical to Megatron's. He had huge, broad shoulders, covered with 
tan fur-like faberic that went down to the center of his chest. His 
arms, hands, and legs were pitch black. His fingers were armed with 
razor sharp claws. He held a ferocious face while studying Techy.

"I'm not afraid," she mumbled, keeping her eyes on Beserk. 

"Remember, he's a killer." Sky Knight added.

Beserk snarled as she took a step forward. It was a breathy, almost 
animalistic snarl. He took a step to the side, with his feet spread. 
She took her movements as a threat. 

"Wait a cycle, back up." SkyKnight said. "This isn't working."

She did as he said, inches from the plexi-glass of Beserk's cell. She 
watched him; he began to calm, but kept his optics on Techy.

There was a long pause. They both watched Beserk. He stood on guard, 
turning his head left and right to look at the two scientists. They 
were not his creators. They were not there to give him orders on his 
next mission, so that meant they were enemy.

"I got an idea," Techy said. She walked back up to Beserk, who 
immediately snarled. "Beserk." She withdrew a hand-sized devise and 
held it up. Beserk froze. Ever since they had brought him back on-
line they had to install a shock collar in him to be safe. "Sit 
down." she said. 

He did nothing, just stood in defense. 

"Look." She threw the devise across the room. Beserk watched 
closely. "Sit, like this." She sat down on the floor. Beserk studied 
her, blinking at her. "Come on."

With some confused hesitation, Beserk sat down on the floor with 
her. "See? Good." she remarked. "Now, what's your name?"

Beserk just blinked.

"I'm Techy," she said pointing to herself. "And that's Sky Knight." 
She pointed to the red and orange male leaning against the plex-glass 
window. He waved lightly at Beserk. Techy turned back to Beserk. "And 
you are?" pointing to him.

There was nothing. He continued to stare at her. "Techy," she said, 
pointing again to herself. She pointed back to Beserk.

"Beserk," he said, and jumped. He blinked in surprise. Techy couldn't 
help but to laugh. He had jumped out of surprise of his own voice. He 
sounded identical to Megatron. 

"Good, now we know each other," she said. He smiled and leaned 
forward.

"Where are my masters?" he asked slowly.

"Your masters are under arrest." she said. "It was illegal on what 
they made you do. And it was actually illegal to build you. You're a 
clone, Beserk. You are a clone of Megatron, a Predacon leader. You 
were a drone." Beserk looked down. It was no doubt that he 
remembered. "You're no longer a drone, now. We gave you a brain. But 
some of your old programing still remains. We want to help you to 
become another bot." He looked at her.
